channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Can paving slabs at bottom end of road on even number side be inspected please?, 21st July
item.description:
Many of these slabs are cracked - please can this be inspected and some replaced please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, again, 21st July
item.description:
The manhole cover is loose, again. Can this be actioned as a priority and can a lasting solution be implemented for us not having to report this is loose every 3/4 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 671-679, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway blocked by overhanging bushes and shrubs, 21st July
item.description:
I have reported this problem some time ago. It is impossible to walk along this path. The road sign is completely hidden. Nearly impossible to load car boots when parked in bay facing rearward. This problem has existed for too long now. I’m not sure who is responsible for all this vegetation but I think it should all be chopped down to root level please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hattersfield Close, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unnecessary Personalised Bay, 20th July
item.description:
The personalised disabled bay at 43 Olinda Road is not being used by someone with genuine mobility needs. The resident walks unaided daily. Please reassess and remove the bay to free up space for those who truly need it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Olinda Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped garden waste, 20th July
item.description:
Flat 2 81 Hertford Rd sublet against leasehold terms to dealers w/large dogs. Dealers have left but dogs tore garden up. Asked Flat 2 owners to dispose of garden waste properly after not doing so, put in general waste again and aggressive when challenged.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hertford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household waste (including food), 20th July
item.description:
This has been here for around 10 days. The food is beginning to rot. It looks to have been in a black bin liner which has been broken open (presumably by foxes/rats etc).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farren Road, Perry Vale, London

item.title: Rubbish still being dumped by residents living on the main road, with access from the alleyway, 20th July
item.description:
Household waste is being dumped under the tree from residents living on lower Clapton Road, with access to the alleyway by 1 Powerscroft Road. I note this has previously been reported and is marked as fixed but this is a continued daily problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Under weight dog liveing at number 9 Boscobel house, 20th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Royal Oak Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish all the way along the verge, 20th July
item.description:
I reported this the other day and they said it was fixed! All they did was remove the toys and leave all the rubbish along the verge. It is all the way along the path . As you can see the grass is also so long all rubbish is stuck in there as well. There is mice and rats present at the moment in this area so it needs addressing .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Smarden Drove, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
